reasons_to_visit.details: Witness Madeira bursting into spring color. Gardens like the Botanical Garden and Monte Palace showcase early blooms, and the island's landscapes become increasingly lush and green.
Enjoy pleasant daytime temperatures (avg. 19-20°C), ideal for exploring Funchal's charming streets, walking along levadas, and enjoying outdoor cafes without the summer heat.
Benefit from generally lower prices for flights and accommodation compared to peak season. Explore popular attractions with fewer crowds (unless Easter falls in March).
The comfortable temperatures are great for hiking, especially lower and mid-altitude levadas. Longer daylight hours than winter provide more time for exploration.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Potential for Late Carnival or Early Easter
reasons_to_visit.details: Depending on the year, you might catch the tail end of Carnival celebrations (if very late) or experience the beginning of Easter festivities (if early).
Experience Funchal with a more relaxed, local feel before the main tourist season ramps up, allowing for easier interaction and a slower pace.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March weather can be unpredictable. While often sunny, be prepared for rain showers, wind, and potentially cloudier days, especially in the mountains. Flexibility is key.
Temperatures drop in the evenings (avg. low 13°C), requiring sweaters or jackets.
The Atlantic remains cool for swimming (around 18°C), although warmer than previous months.
If Easter week falls in March, expect a significant increase in visitors, higher prices, and busier attractions. Book well in advance.
Higher altitude trails (Pico do Arieiro etc.) can still experience challenging weather (fog, wind, heavy rain) and require careful planning and checking conditions.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain showers, but often interspersed with sunny periods. Can be breezy.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters/fleece, waterproof jacket. Comfortable, water-resistant walking shoes essential. Umbrella useful.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to Moderate. Generally quiet start to the month.
tourism_level.pricing: Good shoulder season value usually available.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Calm transition from winter to spring. Pleasant for relaxed exploration and enjoying the emerging greenery.

events_holidays.name: Potential End of Carnival (if late)
events_holidays.description: If Carnival dates fall very late, the final parades or events might occur in the first days of March.
events_holidays.notes: Check specific Carnival dates for the year if traveling early March.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the charming streets, admire the painted doors, browse artisan shops, and enjoy the relatively quiet atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ideal temperatures for walking. Stop for a coffee or Poncha at a local bar.

unique_experiences.description: Experience the vibrant market atmosphere. See displays of exotic fruits, early spring vegetables, colourful flowers, and the fish market.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Best Mon-Fri mornings. Lively buzz. Try some unusual fruits.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk a Lower Levada (e.g., Levada dos Piornais)
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy an accessible walk along an irrigation channel offering views over Funchal and the coast, surrounded by greening vegetation.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Relatively flat and easy. Check weather forecast. Wear comfortable shoes. Can be combined with exploring nearby areas.

unique_experiences.description: Learn about the production of Madeira wine and enjoy a tasting. A good option for a potentially rainy afternoon.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book in advance. Several options within walking distance in Funchal center.

weather.precipitation: Rain still possible but frequency may decrease. More consistent sunshine and warmer days likely. Daylight hours noticeably longer.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering. Sunscreen increasingly useful on clear days. Good time for visiting gardens.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, increasing towards month end. Can become very busy if Easter falls during this period.
tourism_level.pricing: Remains generally shoulder season, but expect sharp increases for Easter week if applicable. Book Easter travel far ahead.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Distinct spring feeling. More activity, gardens blooming. Can be busy and festive if Easter occurs.

events_holidays.name: Easter Week (Semana Santa) Activities (if applicable)
events_holidays.description: If Easter falls late March, expect religious processions (especially Good Friday), special services at Sé Cathedral, traditional Easter sweets ('amêndoas', 'folar') in shops.
events_holidays.notes: Good Friday and Easter Sunday may see some closures. Accommodation prices and crowds surge.

events_holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day (observed by some pubs)
events_holidays.description: Some pubs in Funchal, particularly those popular with expats, might have themed events or promotions.
events_holidays.notes: Not a local holiday; celebrations are venue-specific.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Botanical Garden or Monte Palace Garden
unique_experiences.description: See the gardens bursting into spring colour with various flowers blooming. Enjoy the pleasant temperatures for exploration.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Combine Monte Palace with a cable car ride. Botanical Garden accessible by bus or its own cable car.

unique_experiences.activity: Ride the Funchal Cable Car to Monte
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy spectacular panoramic views over Funchal and the harbour as you ascend to the village of Monte.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Best on a clear day. Can be combined with visiting Monte Church, gardens, or taking a toboggan ride down.

unique_experiences.where: e.g., Levada do Rei, Levada do Alecrim, Levada dos Balcões
unique_experiences.description: Explore more of Madeira's famous levada network as weather potentially improves and days lengthen.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather forecasts and trail conditions carefully. Wear appropriate hiking gear. Bring water and snacks. Start reasonably early.
unique_experiences.best_time: Morning / Early Afternoon on dry days

unique_experiences.where: Cafes in Funchal center, Lido area, or Old Town
unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of pleasant sunny spells to sit outside a cafe, enjoy a coffee ('bica' or 'chinesa') and a local pastry like Pastel de Nata or Queijada.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Many cafes have outdoor seating. Great way to relax and people-watch.
